inference:
The area of the pentagon is equal to the sum of the areas of the three triangles that make up the pentagon.

The area of the triangle with sides of length 15, 20, and 27 is 
$$A_1 = \frac{1}{2} \times 15 \times 20 \times \sin(27^\circ) = 79.45 \approx 79 \text{ square units}$$

The area of the triangle with sides of length 20, 27, and 24 is 
$$A_2 = \frac{1}{2} \times 20 \times 27 \times \sin(24^\circ) = 112.64 \approx 113 \text{ square units}$$

The area of the triangle with sides of length 24, 27, and 20 is 
$$A_3 = \frac{1}{2} \times 24 \times 27 \times \sin(20^\circ) = 63.79 \approx 64 \text{ square units}$$

Therefore, the area of the pentagon is 
$$A = A_1 + A_2 + A_3 = 79 + 113 + 64 = 256 \text{ square units}$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$256$}. I hope it is correct.

question:
The area of the pentagon is equal to the sum of the areas of the three triangles that make up the pentagon.

The area of the triangle with sides of length 15, 20, and 27 is 
$$A_1 = \frac{1}{2} \times 15 \times 20 \times \sin(27^\circ) = 79.45 \approx 79 \text{ square units}$$

The area of the triangle with sides of length 20, 27, and 24 is 
$$A_2 = \frac{1}{2} \times 20 \times 27 \times \sin(24^\circ) = 112.64 \approx 113 \text{ square units}$$

The area of the triangle with sides of length 24, 27, and 20 is 
$$A_3 = \frac{1}{2} \times 24 \times 27 \times \sin(20^\circ) = 63.79 \approx 64 \text{ square units}$$

Therefore, the area of the pentagon is 
$$A = A_1 + A_2 + A_3 = 79 + 113 + 64 = 256 \text{ square units}$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$256$}. I hope it is correct.
